documents.title: Microservices Design Patterns
documents.text: Microservices architecture improves scalability by decomposing applications into small, independent services that can be scaled individually.

documents.title: Database Connection Management
documents.text: Connection pooling is essential for database performance. Best practices include setting appropriate pool sizes and timeout values.

documents.title: Scaling Microservices
documents.text: Horizontal scaling of microservices requires load balancing and service discovery mechanisms.

documents.title: API Rate Limiting Guide
documents.text: Implementing rate limiting protects APIs from abuse. Common strategies include token bucket and sliding window algorithms.

documents.title: Connection Pool Tuning
documents.text: Database connection pools should be tuned based on workload. Monitor active connections and adjust pool size accordingly.

documents.title: Rate Limiting Strategies
documents.text: API rate limiting can be implemented at various levels: per-user, per-IP, or per-API key.

documents.title: Service Mesh for Microservices
documents.text: Service mesh provides observability and traffic management for microservices architectures.

documents.title: API Gateway Patterns
documents.text: API gateways centralize cross-cutting concerns like authentication, rate limiting, and routing.

documents.title: Kubernetes Blue-Green Deployments
documents.text: Blue-green deployment strategy in Kubernetes enables zero-downtime releases by switching between environments.

documents.title: Rolling Updates in Kubernetes
documents.text: Kubernetes rolling updates gradually replace old pods with new ones, ensuring continuous service availability.

documents.title: Event-Driven Architecture Fundamentals
documents.text: Event-driven architecture decouples services through asynchronous message passing, improving scalability and resilience.

documents.title: Event Sourcing Patterns
documents.text: Event sourcing stores all changes as a sequence of events, enabling audit trails and temporal queries.
